definition: ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous

sentences.english: We continued our select coastal journey in Fujian, which boasts scenic beauty and a brilliant cultural tradition.
sentences.chinese: 我們在風光秀美，文化燦爛的福建繼續海疆精華之旅。

sentences.english: Under such situations, many people feel worried.
sentences.chinese: 面對複雜的海疆形勢，許多國人感到憂慮。

sentences.english: China currently has unresolved land and sea border disputes with 11 other neighbours.
sentences.chinese: 中國目前與其它11個鄰國存在領土和海疆糾紛。

sentences.english: Free to sail the seas beyond the edges of the map.
sentences.chinese: 可以自由穿梭輿圖外的海疆，也沒有死亡的約束了。

sentences.english: Our military still protects our shores.
sentences.chinese: 我們的軍隊還在守衛海疆。

sentences.english: The ship is in British waters.
sentences.chinese: 這條船行駛在英國的海疆裏。

definition: East China Sea/East Sea (Chinese mythology and ancient geography)
border station/strategic defensive position on frontier
to garrison the border/to guard the frontier/exile to a border garrison post
